description:
Job Description & Summary

Reporting to the PwC China Human Capital Strategy and Transformation CoE Lead, the HR Transformation and Change Management Lead is responsible for end-to-end implementation of the new target operating model and leading the change management work stream, proactively balancing scope, schedule, budget, risk, project team, outcomes, and benefits.

Key responsibilities include:

Target Operating Model for the People Organisation

•With the high-level design of the future state Target Operating model confirmed, the HR Tranformation Project Lead will engage key stakeholders to design the detailed team structure, scope, roles and responsibilities of the future state HR teams.

•Leverage past HC transformation experience, leading practices, and connections with other PwC network firms to apply key learnings to develop implementation and workforce transition and change management plan to ensure a successful transformation

•Post implementation, conduct HR activity analysis and other satisfaction surveys to gather input on the impact and effectiveness of the new TOM model, and provide recommendations for further improvements to ensure maximum benefit realisation

Change Management, Culture and Values

•Own and drive the change management strategy and plans for the continuous transformation of the People Organisation

•Work closely with key stakeholders to design change strategy and plan to implement key People Priorities

•Work with a small team to implement change management plans for key people priorities and provide advisory support to other people initiatives

•Design and implement ongoing initiatives to further promote the PwC Culture and Values and continue to drive the right behaviours

Ways of working

•Collaborate with key stakeholders (e.g. business and HC leadership) to understand business requirements and objectives

•Support HC Strategy and Transformation CoE Lead to coordinate the delivery of the end to end new target operating model

•Motivate and lead the project team with enthusiasm and drive team effectiveness

Requirements

•12+ years of experience in HR Transformation and Change Management, having implemented a new target operating model (operating model, structure, process, ways of working and governance) for one or more organizations

•Previous HR Transformation experience to include but not limited to: HR activity analysis, detailed HR organisation design, capability reviews, change management, and workforce transition planning

•Previous change management experience to include but not limited to: Stakeholder and change impact assessment, change management, communications, training and workforce transition plan design

•Flexible and capable to manage the end to end HR transformation workstreams in a complex global/territory capacity

•Ability to work with different levels of stakeholders to develop relationships, establish credibility and instill confidence

•Ability to identify and solve problems objectively using analysis, leading practices, and experience

•Excellent analytical, articulation, project management, and communication skills

•Prior experience and/or familiarity with agile strategies and some of the relevant HC technologies would be of benefit

A. JOB SUMMARY

The Executive Director is accountable for:

Developing and implementing Playright's strategic plan that aligns with its positioning as an active play advocate
Achieving financial goals of the organisation and ensuring proper financial control
Overseeing operation of the organisation/services and safeguarding compliance with regulatory requirements
Expanding pool of supporters for the accomplishment of Playright’s mission
Supporting the Board of Directors for good governance of the organisation
Developing a solid team that is passionate, accountable, and capable to meet Playright’s strategic goals

B. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Strategic & Business Development

Bring in global perspectives, research, and best practices, and develop insightful local applications
Work with the Board in the strategic planning process, and review the strategic plan regularly to ensure that services and programmes are tightly linked to Playright’s mission and vision
Translate the strategic plan into responsibilities for senior management, in consideration of the unique professions in play environment, hospital play, and playwork, to follow through, monitor, and implement the plans and use the performance results to inform decisions on strategic planning and resources allocation
Lead service strategies, human resources planning, and pilot new service projects for the sustained growth of Playright
Support the Board to carry out its governance functions

Financial Management & Fundraising

Prepare/review multi-year financial plan for the Board’s discussion and approval of resource allocation, funding plans, and investment objectives in the context of strategic goals
Ensure timely financial statements/audits for the Board’s regular review
Initiate and materialise fundraising opportunities, support the Board in fundraising activities, and achieve the financial goals of the organization

Organisation & Service / Consultancy Programme Operations

Work with the Board to set performance targets for the organisation
Oversee the operations of the organisation, services, and consultancy programme in an effective and efficient manner, and in accordance with high standards and expectations
Monitor and safeguard compliance with all regulatory and funding requirements
Assess and monitor potential risks, and ensure mitigation plans are in place

Stakeholders’ Engagement

Act as an effective representative of Playright, actively engaging with all internal, external, and international stakeholders. Seek stakeholder feedback to inform strategy and resource allocation
Expand pool of supporters, funders, and partners, gaining the buy-in needed to accomplish the mission and goals of Playright
Ensure that impacts of Playright are communicated effectively to stakeholders

People Management / Competency Enhancement

Lead, manage, and develop high performance teams, and be a role model for Playright’s purpose and value
Communicate and enhance the competencies of the different professionals in play, and make connections to maximise the impact for play advocacy
Cultivate a culture of professionalism, trust, commitment, and inclusion in all levels of the organisation

C. PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES

Love of PLAY – exceptional enthusiasm. Inspirational leadership. Bring new and creative ideas to Playright
Excellent analytical, negotiation, interpersonal, motivational, and change management skills
Strong ability to establish credibility and relationships with diverse individuals and groups
Strong COMMUNICATOR – sensitivity to internal and external environment of Playright. Strong advocate for Playright externally and Inspirational role model internally
Solid judgement to make decisions that are aligned with the mission and goals, able to make difficult calls when needed, and manage with transparency, empathy, and respect. Willing to work at execution level when needed
Mindfulness in working in NGOs, but with operational experience to drive system and implementation excellence

D. JOB REQUIREMENTS

Degree in Management or Social Welfare or Health Care or Architecture or related discipline, or other similar qualifications
Significant proven record of achievement in a management or strategist position, preferably child-related. Experience in running a self-financed service or social enterprise is an advantage
Significant proven record of achievement in effective partnership management
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in Chinese and English
Computer literate

job_title: Commercial Bank - Priority International Coverage Executive (ICE) - Executive Director, Hong Kong
description:
Employer Description

The Commercial Banking Division represents a strategically important business to the firm, delivering extensive industry knowledge, local expertise and dedicated service to over 24,000 clients including corporations, municipalities, financial institutions and not-for-profit entities. In Asia Pacific (APAC), Commercial Banking International (CBI) Team serves subsidiaries of US multi-national organizations with annual revenues ranging from US$20 million to US$2 billion across more than 2,000 clients in the region. As well as other multi-national corporations' subsidiaries where their HQ are based in Europe and few Asia markets.

The team has helped clients take advantage of global opportunities by connecting them with international cash management, trade, liquidity management, financing and foreign exchange solutions. A qualified network of in-country experts and dedicated Parent Bankers leverage local knowledge to customize solutions to help clients expand internationally, navigate the complexities of global payments and understand market nuances.

Job Description

An opportunity is available to join the Hong Kong team of J.P. Morgan's Commercial Banking International (CBI - HK) in the capacity of an Executive Director/Vice President located in Hong Kong as International Coverage Executive (ICE).

The ICE is responsible for the overall relationship management as well as transaction services requirements of the APAC subsidiaries of Corporate Client Banking / Specialized Industry (CCBSI) segment. Leveraging the firm's capabilities to meet our clients' domestic and international needs, the team provides local market expertise and industry knowledge, combined with active coordination globally of J.P. Morgan's extensive product and service expertise to deliver comprehensive solutions across multiple product and service disciplines. Traditional Commercial Banking product and service capabilities include but not limited to treasury services, trade finance, bilateral and syndicated commercial lending, foreign exchange and investment banking.

Key Responsibilities

The CBI Hong Kong Team covering CCBSI clients, the subsidiaries of North America/EMEA/APAC headquartered (HQ) companies operating in HK, with primary focus of Asia Pacific key decision makers and influencers that are based in Hong Kong. We are looking for an experienced Senior Regional Banker/Sales, with strong industry and client knowledge.

Build and develop both Local and or Regional Treasurer/CFO level coverage of CBI selected clients by active prospecting and serve as a focal point of contact within J.P. Morgan
Responsible for marketing in-scope banking products (including: Treasury Services (TS), Trade, FX and loan products) and drive TS opportunities.
Development of forward-looking new business plans for (local or regional) clients and the maintenance of existing business relationships, partnering with HQ parent banking teams and respectiveICE teams to drive and deliver financial goals by conducting comprehensive client analysis: Conversion of client analysis into concrete financial solutions
Work closely with International Product Specialists (IPS) and Parent Banking team globally to increase treasury services (TS) wallet share of existing clients as well as cross-sell products, annual reviews and portfolio statistical reporting
Maintain the existing portfolio of CCBSI clients, including client due diligence, KYC, AML and other requirements
Manage the sales pipelines, book timely client call memos, be responsible to coordinate with Associates & product partners for preparing proposals/presentations for clients
Qualifications

More than 10 years industry experience as Client Relationship manager or Sales coverage with proven ability to build and develop client relationships with specific focus on multi-national clients for transaction banking and other services, win new business, close transactions and develop networks, both internally and externally
This role is also open to VP level candidates
Demonstrable credit knowledge
Strong knowledge of Treasury Services products including cash management, liquidity and cross-border products would be a key requirement
Excellence in oral and written communication with proven strength for personal engagement
Flexibility to co-ordinate, manage multiple transactions and processes while ensuring delivery against deadlines, client expectations and business priorities
Ability to work consistently across different time zones and geographies dealing with numerous stakeholders
Self-starting with clear results orientation and a capacity to operate independently, appropriately balancing short, medium and long-term objectives
Enthusiastic and team orientated
Strong influencing skills and proven track record of managing cross cultural environments
Language Requirements

Fluent in spoken and written English & Mandarin. Cantonese and Japanese language skills would be an advantage.

BIPO is a one-stop leading human resources provider in Asia Pacific, focused on providing organisations with innovative ways to manage complex end-to-end HR processes. Through our cloud and mobile-based Human Resources Management system as well as industry-leading solutions such as Payroll Outsourcing, HRMS Solutions, HR value add consultancy services, we help companies transform their HR operations to and beyond their expectations, while achieving business goals related to cost and profitability.

BIPO’s headquarter is located in Singapore and R&D Centre in Indonesia and Malaysia. The company has offices in Australia, India, Japan, Korea, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Vietnam, Cambodia, Myanmar, Thailand, UK, Mexico, etc..

This role will be reporting into Managing Director, North Asia who based in Hong Kong office.


1. Overall management of the General Manager in respect to:-

Management of staff: Plan and steer resources and capacities efficiently for all internal departments including Project, Service Delivery, Business Development, Finance and in line with business pipeline and requirements to ensure hire sufficient team and resources locally
Legal compliance: Ensure the business/service model execution locally is in line with the law and regulation of Taiwan
Inform staff appropriately and transparently regarding country and company strategy and policy
Provide guidance to staff with regard to performance expected and establish smart targets and key performance indicators in line with the district and company strategy
Conduct regular performance reviews together with functional leaders in order to evaluate performance and results, recognize strengths and weaknesses among staff members and initiate training measures to support skills development
Coach and mentor potential/future talent within the country team and plan succession within the district
Promote cross-functional cooperation and information flow with other department/country

 2. Strategic Business Development

Active sales development of top customers within Taiwan country based on our available products including Payroll outsourcing Service, HRMS Solutions and other HR Consultancy Service
Continuously analyze competitor activities and local industry trends and attend local industry-related functions
Develop business plan for the country in conjunction with the team and provide
prepared information for investment decisions to management
Positively contribute towards global company initiatives, support implementation and lead required change management initiatives
Triple up the market shares in short period of time

3. HR Consultancy

Liaise with clients to formulate HR strategic and practical plans to address human resource matters including but not limited to
Provide guidance and ensure client’s HR policies and practices are fully complied with local labour law and other related rules and regulations
Conduct HR related analysis, develop reports and present insights to clients where it is necessary

4. Develop and control budget

Plan and forecast annual budget using established indicators and tools appropriately
Review and monitor budget against country’s P&L, create action plan in case of deviation
Perform vendor price review on local suppliers, striving to reduce cost year on year
Ensure timely closing of files and delivery of all accounting relevant information to finance department
Manage profitability of files and look at bottom-line results effects
Support local specific reporting requests

You are expected to have an excellent knowledge of all HR/Technology business processes combined with strategic thinking and good managerial skills. It is also essential that you conduct yourself with high integrity and good interpersonal skills.

A minimum of Bachelor's degree in relevant field from reputable university
15 years of working experience in HR/Business Technology leadership role, at least 8 years in senior management position in relevant industries
Hands-on management style is a must
Strong commercial sense, business selling, leadership and maturity
Excellent interpersonal and functional technical skills
Good in English and Mandarin, both in verbal and written
